cleaned_text: The Top Traditional Chinese Medicine Herbs Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) has been used for centuries to treat a variety of conditions. While the effectiveness of [TCM](https://www.nccih.nih.gov/health/traditional-chinese-medicine-what-you-need-to-know) is still being studied by modern medicine, there are a number of herbs that are commonly used in Chinese medicine that have shown to be effective in treating various ailments. Here are 10 of the most popular [traditional Chinese herbs](https://www.acuatlanta.net/) taken for their health benefits. 1. Ginseng (Ren Shen or Hua Qi Shen Wan) Ginseng is one of the most popular Chinese herbs in TCM. It is used to treat a variety of conditions, including fatigue, poor appetite, and low energy levels. Ginseng is also said to boost the immune system, improve mental function, reduce stress levels, enhance sexual function, and fight inflammation. There are many different types of [ginseng](https://www.acuatlanta.net/herbal-supplements-ginseng-products-9_533_705.html) available on the market today. The most common are Asian ginseng ( [Panax ginseng](https://www.acuatlanta.net/prince-of-peace-panax-ginseng-extractum-3.3-ounce-10-vials-x-10cc-p-73023.html)) and [American ginseng](https://www.acuatlanta.net/advanced_search_result.php?search_in_description=1&keywords=american+ginseng) (Panax quinquefolius). Both of these herbs are thought to be beneficial for health. Asian ginseng is typically taken as a tea or capsule. [American ginseng](https://www.acuatlanta.net/health-concerns-tremella-and-american-ginseng-90-capsules-p-17776.html) is usually consumed in the form of powder, tablets, or capsules. Ginseng can also be found in some energy drinks, [tea](https://www.acuatlanta.net/prince-of-peace-korean-ginseng-instant-tea-100-tea-bags-p-74504.html), and [other products](https://www.acuatlanta.net/energique-american-ginseng-2-ounce-p-78953.html). How much ginseng should you take per day? The amount of ginseng you should take each day depends on many factors, including your age, health condition, and the reason you are taking ginseng. Typically, 2-3 grams of dried ginseng root per day is considered a safe dose. It is best to start with a lower dose and increase gradually as needed. What are the possible side effects of taking ginseng? Ginseng is generally considered safe for most people. However, it can cause some side effects, such as insomnia, anxiety, and stomach upset. It is also important to note that ginseng can interact with certain medications, so it is important to speak to a healthcare provider before taking this herb. If you are looking for an herbal therapy supplement that may improve your overall health, consider trying ginseng. This popular herb has been used for centuries in Chinese medicine and continues to be one of the most popular medicinal herbs in Asian countries as well as for [TCM practitioners](https://www.acuatlanta.com/) and in alternative medicine today. 2. The general recommended dosage of astragalus is 9-15 grams per day, but it's best to start with a lower dose and gradually increase as needed. It's also important to consult with a healthcare professional before taking astragalus, as it may interact with certain medications. What are the possible side effects of taking astragalus? Astragalus is generally considered safe when taken in moderate amounts. However, some people may experience side effects such as diarrhea, upset stomach, or skin rash. If you experience any adverse reactions after taking astragalus, stop using the herb and speak with your doctor. 3. The main active compound in licorice is [glycyrrhizin](https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/agricultural-and-biological-sciences/glycyrrhizin), which has been shown to have numerous health benefits. Some of the most well-known benefits of licorice include: - Soothing digestive problems: Licorice can be helpful in treating digestive disorders such as stomach ulcers, heartburn and indigestion. This is due to the fact that it increases the production of mucus, which helps protect the stomach lining from the acidic digestive juices. - Reducing inflammation: Licorice has anti-inflammatory properties and can be helpful in treating conditions such as arthritis and asthma. - Boosting immunity: Licorice can help to boost the immune system, making it more effective at fighting off infections. - Regulating blood sugar levels: Glycyrrhizin, the main active compound in licorice, has been shown to improve insulin sensitivity and help regulate blood sugar levels. This makes licorice a good herbal therapy for people with diabetes or prediabetes. - Reducing stress: Licorice has been shown to lower levels of the stress hormone cortisol. This may explain why licorice is often used as a natural remedy for stress and anxiety. - Supporting liver health: Licorice can help protect the liver from damage and promote its detoxification processes. - Reducing the risk of cancer: Some studies have shown that licorice may help reduce the risk of certain types of cancer, such as stomach and colon cancer. - Supporting respiratory health: Licorice can be helpful in treating respiratory conditions such as bronchitis and coughs. This is due to the fact that it helps increase mucus production, which can help clear the lungs of irritants. - Enhancing testosterone levels: Glycyrrhizin, the main active compound in licorice, has been shown to increase testosterone levels. This may explain why licorice is often used as a natural remedy for low libido and erectile dysfunction. - Supporting skin health: Licorice has anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties, which can help to protect the skin from damage and premature aging. How much licorice should you take per day? For general health, 2-4 grams of [licorice](https://www.acuatlanta.net/sun-ten-single-herbs-gan-cao-100-grams-p-46133.html) root per day is typically recommended. For more serious conditions, up to 15 grams per day may be used. If you are pregnant or breast-feeding, it is best to avoid licorice altogether. What are the possible side effects of taking licorice? The most common side effect of licorice is water retention, which can cause bloating and weight gain. If you are taking any medications, it's important to speak to your doctor before taking licorice as it may interact with some drugs. 4. There is no one-size-fits-all answer to this question, as the amount of ginger you should take depends on your individual health situation. However, a common dosage range is 1-3 grams per day.
